R.version

```{r}
library(ape)
library(fastmatch)
library(quadprog)
library(phangorn)

library(geiger)
```

```{r}
packageVersion("ape")
```
```{r}
## load ape
library(ape)
```

```{r}
## read tree from string
text.string<-
    "(((((((cow, pig),whale),(bat,(lemur,human))),(robin,iguana)),coelacanth),gold_fish),shark);"
vert.tree<-read.tree(text=text.string)
```

```{r}
plot(vert.tree,no.margin=TRUE,edge.width=2)
```
```{r}
## load phytools
library(phytools)
```

```{r}
roundPhylogram(vert.tree)
```
```{r}
plot(unroot(vert.tree),type="unrooted",no.margin=TRUE,lab4ut="axial",
    edge.width=2)
```
```{r}
vert.tree
```
```{r}
?read.tree
NJst.tree<-read.nexus(file="NJst.tre")
NJst.tree
```
```{r}
?plotTree
plotTree(NJst.tree,ftype="i",fsize=0.6,lwd=2)
```
```{r}
plot(NJst.tree,no.margin=FALSE,edge.width=0.5)
```
```{r}
Ntip(NJst.tree) ##66 species in this tree
```

```{r}
plot(unroot(NJst.tree),type="unrooted",cex=0.6,
    use.edge.length=FALSE,lab4ut="axial",
    no.margin=TRUE)
##unrooted tree 
```
```{r}
plotTree(NJst.tree,type="fan",fsize=0.7,lwd=2,
    ftype="i") ##how do we make the tree branches bigger??
```
```{r}
##all the species names 
NJst.tree$tip.label
```

```{r}
##add an arrow on a specific branch tip 
plotTree(NJst.tree,type="fan",fsize=0.7,lwd=1,
    ftype="i")
add.arrow(NJst.tree,tip="A_saundersii_saundersii",arrl=1)
```
